posts.post_content:
This, like the vast majority of WWK's vampires, is begging to be put in the Vampire deck that's been seeing a lot of success lately, but I just don't see it fitting. [Malakir Bloodwitch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Malakir Bloodwitch) is such a superior card for the spot of the 5-drop, and while both beg to be removed, Bloodwitch not only can dodge [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt), but [Path to Exile](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Path to Exile) as well, neither of which the Ruin Sage can live through. Bloodwitch also has flying and the blood-sucking ability, and while [Cruel Edict](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cruel Edict) on a stick is nice, your creatures shouldn't even be worrying about getting rid of the opponent's creatures; you should have [Vampire Nocturnus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nocturnus) out by then and be flying over your opponents for the win.  
  
Is he a bad card? No. Just...he's not the best Vampire out there. Perhaps EDH will be kinder to him; I can see him being played there as a great general to stop your opponent from ever casting creatures until he's remov... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
This, like the vast majority of WWK's vampires, is begging to be put in the Vampire deck that's been seeing a lot of success lately, but I just don't see it fitting. Malakir Bloodwitch is such a superior card for the spot of the 5-drop, and while both beg to be removed, Bloodwitch not only can dodge Lightning Bolt, but Path to Exile as well, neither of which the Ruin Sage can live through. Bloodwitch also has flying and the blood-sucking ability, and while Cruel Edict on a stick is nice, your creatures shouldn't even be worrying about getting rid of the opponent's creatures; you should have Vampire Nocturnus out by then and be flying over your opponents for the win.

Is he a bad card? No. Just...he's not the best Vampire out there. Perhaps EDH will be kinder to him; I can see him being played there as a great general to stop your opponent from ever casting creatures until he's remov... (see all)

Posted By: Paleopaladin (7/9/2010 11:28:29 AM)

posts.post_content: I can pull him out of bolt range with a single [Urge to Feed](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Urge to Feed) and he really helps swing things around in the late game in short order. Block, Urge if needed, tap him, and then on your upkeep your opponent loses another creature. Seems pretty solid, I'm gonna be running 2 in my vampire deck. He gets you out of a bind if you're losing and he finishes the game faster if you're winning. Can't really complain about it.

posts.post_content:
T'is a shame he isn't a 3/4, but you gotta work with what you're got.   
  
It's great that they refer to the web comic in the flavour, because most cards don't. I haven't really seen a card when Liliana vents out her hatred for angels and how righteous they are, not knowing the irony. I really wish they had.  
  
Regardless, one way or another, don't consider playing this outside of Vampires. As [Magus of the Abyss](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magus of the Abyss) was a timeshifted version of [The Abyss](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=The Abyss), this is the "timeshifted" version of [Call to the Grave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Call to the Grave)... sort of.
posts.html:
T'is a shame he isn't a 3/4, but you gotta work with what you're got.

It's great that they refer to the web comic in the flavour, because most cards don't. I haven't really seen a card when Liliana vents out her hatred for angels and how righteous they are, not knowing the irony. I really wish they had.

Regardless, one way or another, don't consider playing this outside of Vampires. As Magus of the Abyss was a timeshifted version of The Abyss, this is the "timeshifted" version of Call to the Grave... sort of.

Posted By: atemu1234 (3/30/2012 9:01:28 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This is an excellent card for a black vampire deck. here's the deal, he's not that vulnerable to lightning bolts and others if you structure your deck properly. Assuming your playing Bloodline Keeker and Vampire Nocturnus, you already have buffs to keep his defense high enough, and since they cost less, chances are you have one of them out first. Sorry, but this card is greatly superior to Malakir Bloodwitch for the simple fact that you keep your opponents creatures in check. Malakir gives you a one-time bonus that offsets a few health between you and your opponent, but otherwise, is not the best value at a 5 casting cost. I dont play it in my vamp deck and I dont miss it a bit. After honing down over hundreds of games, my vampire deck is now extremely nasty.
posts.html:

Posted By: Captainobvious99 (2/17/2012 7:25:31 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This isn't even close to Braids, that's why. Read the two cards carefully, Braids' mechanic is far more aggressive and hits 2 other card types, so it doesn't stop if they neglect dropping anymore creatures... they don't get a chance to play around it, whereas with this guy it is not until the owner's upkeep that anyone has to sacrifice a creature. There's also a big difference between 4 and 5 mana, and accelerating her out turn 2 as opposed to this guy turn 3. Lastly I don't a lot of people ever opted to play this in the 1st place, whereas tons of people used to abuse Braids.
posts.html:

Posted By: TuffWebz (12/18/2011 12:13:56 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: A fairly good vampire. I've started running this over [Sheoldred, Whispering One](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sheoldred, Whispering One). It costs less, benefits from [Bloodline Keeper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodline Keeper) and [Captivating Vampire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Captivating Vampire), and in my vampire deck, I'm more interested in them sacrificing a creature than bringing a creature back. Getting a creature back is nice, but the sacrifice is the main prize for triggers on [Falkenrath Noble](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Falkenrath Noble) and [Sangromancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sangromancer).
posts.html:

Getting a creature back is nice, but the sacrifice is the main prize for triggers on Falkenrath Noble and Sangromancer.
